unnormalised: **Automotive Industry Sees Barrage of Vehicle Launches, Offering Diverse Options to Indian Consumers**
normalised: **Automotive Industry Sees Barrage of Vehicle Launches, Offering Diverse Options to Indian Consumers**

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market is witnessing a flurry of new vehicle launches across various segments. Dr. Meena Iyer, Head of Automotive Engineering at IIT Madras, highlights the growing demand for fuel-efficient and technologically advanced cars as a driving force.
normalised: The Indian automotive market is witnessing a flurry of new vehicle launches across various segments. Doctor Meena Iyer, Head of Automotive Engineering at I I T Madras, highlights the growing demand for fuel-efficient and technologically advanced cars as a driving force.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki recently unveiled its new compact SUV, the "Agni," targeting young professionals seeking a stylish and affordable ride. Simultaneously, Tata Motors launched an electric variant of its popular sedan, the "Disha EV," promising a range of 400 km on a single charge.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki recently unveiled its new compact S U V, the "Agni," targeting young professionals seeking a stylish and affordable ride. Simultaneously, Tata Motors launched an electric variant of its popular sedan, the "Disha E V," promising a range of four hundred kilometer on a single charge.

unnormalised: These launches cater to the diverse needs of Indian consumers, from budget-conscious families to environmentally aware individuals. The "Agni," priced starting at Rs. 7.5 Lakh, boasts a spacious interior and a mileage of 22 kmpl. Meanwhile, the "Disha EV," with its zero-emission capabilities and a battery production unit occupying 50,000 sq ft in Pune, signifies a growing commitment to sustainable mobility. The festive season is expected to further boost sales, adding to the already competitive landscape.
normalised: These launches cater to the diverse needs of Indian consumers, from budget-conscious families to environmentally aware individuals. The "Agni," priced starting at rupee seven point five lakh, boasts a spacious interior and a mileage of twenty two kilometer per liter. Meanwhile, the "Disha E V," with its zero-emission capabilities and a battery production unit occupying fifty thousand square feet in Pune, signifies a growing commitment to sustainable mobility. The festive season is expected to further boost sales, adding to the already competitive landscape.
